restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: I dined here for my birthday as good as the food tasted all members of my party felt sick from in a few hours later. Service was great friendly serve just had a hard time getting their attention sometimes.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
Food was not delicious. Just regular level of taste, but very expensive when consider the taste and dish size.
Server was very rushing us to pay, and keep asking me for the card which was very unacceptable experience
Everything is about the veiw. No other reason to visit.
The view, you can enjoy by just going up to the tower, not the restuarant.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: We went on Feb Dinner time, not so crowded on the day.  Relax and comfortable.  Great view, Great Service, Great Food.  We had a wonderful evening.  Recommended to go at winter time.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: It’s a great value when you consider you can visit the observation deck and other areas as part of your meal cost. The food is delicious and the views can’t be beat!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Great way to see Toronto and our server, Stephen, was fabulous!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Dining at the CN Tower’s 360 Restaurant is an unforgettable experience. The food is delicious and beautifully presented, with local ingredients and perfectly cooked dishes that match the stunning, rotating view of Toronto. The service is friendly and professional, making it an ideal spot for special occasions or anyone wanting a memorable dining experience with world-class scenery.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
I used to have very high expectations for 360 Restaurant at the CN Tower, especially because my previous visit last yeat was decent. Unfortunately, this time the experience was extremely disappointing.

The food quality was far below expectations. The appetizer was extremely hard to chew and I couldn’t finish it. Our main course (rib and pork) had an unpleasant smell and taste! It was not enjoyable at all. For a restaurant of this reputation and price point, this was shocking. The only item that was acceptable was the dessert.

Service was also lacking. Our server was not attentive; I waited nearly 20 minutes just to receive the bill. When I asked if she could take a photo of us for my friend’s birthday, I felt an uncomfortable attitude, which made me decide not to ask again.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: our experience was disappointing. The soup arrived cold and had to be returned. The steak contained roughly 25% fat, which made it poor value for the price. The waiter didn’t offer coffee or tea and came across as robotic rather than welcoming. Overall, the food lacked flavor and was quite bland. Based on this visit, I wouldn’t recommend this restaurant.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
Awful food, cant cook a steak to a simple medium temp and the mashed potatoes were POWDERED! The bill came out to over 200$ for powdered potatoes
Absolutely insane. Do not recommend to eat here. There are tons quality restaurants around the CN tower that are more worth your money

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: The food was good, the service was wonderful, the ambiance was worth it. We loved it

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
Dining at 360 Restaurant inside the CN Tower is definitely more about the experience than the food itself. The biggest highlight is, without question, the breathtaking revolving 360-degree view of beautiful downtown Toronto. Watching the city skyline and Lake Ontario slowly pass by as you dine is something special and makes for a memorable evening. Part of what you’re paying for is also the convenience of visiting the CN Tower, which adds to the overall attraction.

That said, it is an expensive restaurant, and the pricing clearly reflects the location and rotating feature. The food was good, but not outstanding for the cost. There are several high-end restaurants in Toronto where you can get better overall value and more impressive dishes for the same price or less.

There were a few solid steak options on the menu. The striploin was good, cooked properly and flavorful, but not exceptional. The salmon was decent and enjoyable, while the pasta was just average. They offer a good selection of wines and have a beautiful wine cellar. The staff were nice and polite, knowledgeable about the menu, and generally attentive. However, at times they seemed rushed, wanting to serve quickly and move on to the next table, which made the dining experience feel slightly hurried rather than relaxed. With such stunning views and a premium price point, a slower, more attentive pace would have made the evening feel even more special. It’s also family-friendly with a kids menu available, which is a nice touch.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
At nearly $20, the “truffle fries” were a notable disappointment. Rather than properly infused or finished fries, the dish consisted of what appeared to be standard fries accompanied by a truffle dipping sauce, a distinction that was not made clear on the menu. In a restaurant positioned at this level, one expects more thoughtful execution and transparency, particularly with something marketed as truffle fries. As shown in the attached photo, the presentation and preparation did not reflect the premium description.

The crab and corn chowder was similarly underwhelming. While the concept is appealing, the dish lacked the depth, balance, and refinement one would anticipate at this price point. I have attached a photo for reference.

With a bill approaching $400 for two, the concern is not the cost itself but the inconsistency between pricing and delivery. The steak, however, was well prepared and satisfying, and it stood out as the highlight of the meal.

Service was exceptional. The servers were extremely warm, attentive, and professional throughout the evening. They checked on us frequently without being intrusive and kindly offered to take photos of my fiancée and me, which added a thoughtful and memorable touch to the experience.

Overall, while the hospitality was outstanding and certain elements delivered, some menu items fell short of the standard the setting and price suggest.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
had an extremely disappointing experience at this restaurant. We spent over $300 expecting a nice evening for a special occasion, but unfortunately it turned into a frustrating and uncomfortable night.
The service was particularly poor. Our server repeatedly invaded our personal space while speaking to us, standing far too close and making the experience awkward. Professionalism and basic courtesy were clearly lacking. For a restaurant charging premium prices, the level of service simply did not match the cost.
To make matters worse, there was a mandatory 25% gratuity automatically added to the bill. While I understand service charges in some establishments, it felt unjustified given the quality of service we received. A mandatory tip at that percentage should reflect exceptional service — not the opposite.
Overall, this was not worth the money, especially for a date night or celebration. There are many better restaurants that offer quality food, professional service, and a much more comfortable dining atmosphere. I would strongly recommend looking elsewhere for a special evening out.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: I didn’t really like the food but the view was amazing

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: 360 Restaurant is excellent! The food is delicious, the service is outstanding, and the drinks are special. The view experience is simply phenomenal. I highly recommend it, especially because you can also explore the tourist floors and enjoy even more of the place.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
Very efficient management.
The host gave us the best seat on our anniversary, the staff went above and beyond to make sure we had a good experience.
Vibe was great, food came out pretty fast.
We ordered the Heirloom Carrot and Kohlrabi salad, Corn Chowder, Mushroom Cavatelli, Pimenton Spiced Chicken Supreme, Pumpkin Flan, and Sour Cherry Frangipane.
The salad is probably the best salad I ever had. Rest was pretty good.
Drinks: Clouds and Cream, Up to Something. Both 10/10.
The lower observatory decks were complimentary.
The Wine selection looked pretty good, didn’t try any tho.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
I have attended 360 on a few occasions in the past, and had good experiences, so for this special occasion I thought it would be nice to have it at 360. On this occasion it was for my wife’s 65th birthday and our 40th anniversary, which both fell on the date of our visit at 360.

I typically can be bothered to spend time writing reviews, but on this occasion I felt so disappointed that I must devote time to share this.

Despite having a reservation (5 adults, 2 children, and a baby) we were simply sat at an empty table which happened to be close to the entrance. Although I also reserved a high-chair, one was not provided. Prior to being seated I specifically requested the bill be brought to me, yet it wasn’t. Rather it was provided to one of my guests.

Service was incredibly slow and waiters had to be repeatedly called over for order taking/service. The Sommelier was clearly unfamiliar with wine-pairing and or available stock. Waiter decanted a 25 year-old vintage as if filling a glass of carbonated water. Almost all meals were served with an overwhelming amount of course-ground black peppercorn, not allowing for any other notable favour. Meals were not in keeping with cook requests (eg. medium prime rib initially served well-done, then served rare). Custom ordered dessert (2 cakes) were not as ordered, apart from one of them being dropped before arriving to the table. In fairness to 360, I was informed of the mishap and a tray of assorted desserts was substituted and the cost of the original desserts was waived.

While I understand the concept of a minimum prefixed tip rate for larger groups (20%), it does not promote an incentive for exemplary customer service or allow for adjustment to the tip for substandard service.

Despite having drawn the shortcomings (via email) to the restaurant management (M. Scott), I was simply offered to return (up to 4 people) where a 20% discount would be applied. However response to all my concerns was simply ignored. So essentially I paid a bill and 20% tip for 8 people, and 360 is willing to have 4 people come back for dinner tip-free.

Sure seems unfair or truly considerate.

But how can you expect staff to be customer service driven, with such an attitude and lack of genuine care by management.

So beware and really give serious thought about where you host your special occasion. It seems current 360 management focuses and relies on tourists (1 time customers) rather than developing an environment for repeat customers, or caring about contributing to ensuring a positive special occasion.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: This place is the symbol of Toronto where you would expect to receive top notch service and amazing food. The servers seem to be all clueless middle aged dads. which pairs well with an outdated decor. I’ve received better service at McDonald’s. Safe to say this is the first and last time I spend a birthday here.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
Dinner at 360 The Restaurant was a unique experience! The mussels starter was amazing, though my wife’s soup didn’t quite hit the mark. My salmon main course was okay, but the sides were a bit simple and slightly bitter, while her pork dish was absolutely delicious.
The desserts stole the show—both white and dark chocolate were perfect, and our non-alcoholic cocktails were refreshing and tasty.
With breathtaking panoramic views of Toronto, this place is perfect for a romantic dinner or special occasion, even if some dishes could be improved. Highly recommend for the experience!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
360 Restaurant at the CN Tower is an unforgettable experience.
Breathtaking panoramic views of Toronto, elegant atmosphere, and beautifully presented dishes make this place truly special.
The food is refined and delicious, the service is professional and attentive, and every detail feels well thought out.
This is more than just a restaurant — it’s a full experience that’s perfect for a special occasion or simply to enjoy the city from above.
Highly recommend.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: It was a great experience for the first time. The food was amazing and tasty great customer service and the view was amazing also the restaurant was very clean and staff was so friendly.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Excellent service, very good food, I highly recommend it for a dinner with someone special, friends, family and even just for the view of the city, you could go yourself.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: You only pay for the view , and the service is not ok you can barely understand to the waitress and they expect at least 15 to 20 % on tip which you have to give them 60 to 80 dollars on tip regardless in a bill of 400 for 2 ppl

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
Nice experience

the food was ok
the service was perfect
But birthday cake was so bad I paid 80 dollars for that bad cake sorry I couldn’t eat it
So bad

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: the most expensive cafeteria in terms of food and service, with the most exquisite view, the jarring combination enough to make anyone sad

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Came here for Anniversary on a weekday night the revolving floor gives a 360* view of the city skyline, gardiner expressway and the financial district. The food is good, had Atlantic char which was perfectly cooked and the cocktails were decent. Will recommend a visit.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Second time at the 360. Nice views a d good food

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Food, not so good. Views are amazing 👏🏾

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Really good food and friendly service

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
The view is absolutely incredible and worth the experience on its own. The rotating 360° restaurant makes it extra special, and seeing the entire city while dining is unforgettable.

The food itself is mid, just not that bad, but not the highlight. You’re really paying for the atmosphere and the views, and for that reason alone, it’s still a great experience and something I’d recommend doing at least once.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
Amazing rotating views over Toronto and Lake Ontario, the highlight of the experience.
We had salmon dishes and duck etc., which felt very Canadian, fresh, and nicely presented.
Service was professional, and CN Tower access included with the meal is a big plus.
The food is good, though slightly expensive for what you get; you’re mainly paying for the view.
We parked at a nearby parking garage, which was convenient.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Manager told my family and I that we could go up to the top to make a viewing and the lower area manager named Jason was absolutely rude. Unbelievable they would allow me and my wife and my family to go to the upper area they want us to pay an additional $11 Unreal.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
I had an amazing experience at the 360 Restaurant at the CN Tower while celebrating my birthday 🎂. From the moment I arrived, the staff made me feel incredibly special on my day.

The service was outstanding, the food was absolutely delicious, and the drinks 🍹 were perfect. Everything exceeded my expectations. But what truly stood out the most was how welcoming and genuine the staff were—they made me feel like I was at home.

Thank you to the entire team for making my birthday unforgettable. I will definitely be back and highly recommend this experience to anyone visiting Toronto.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: It was a beautiful dinner, amazing view, delicious food and excelent service, the waiter speaked Spanish and make everything easier for my mom who doesn´t speak English, a once in a lifetime experience!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: I love this place for any celebration

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: The view is nice but the food is horrible especially the steak it served without assortements !

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
My family and I had a lovely time at the 360 restaurant. Ricky and his assistant were phenomenal servers, making sure that we enjoyed every moment and every bite. Ricky was attentive to us all, but made a special connection with my little one and that made the moment even more special. Thank you so much for your attention to detail and care and the love of service you give.
The food was good. The view was great. Our steaks were all well cooked! The crab and corn chowder was exceptional!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Went here for new years, prepaid for the whole dinner, the appetizers was disappointing, the salad was good, and the dinner options was good the bison steak and the ravioli was surprisingly good. For the price I paid I did expect more options and more portions.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Everything was wonderful. The staff were very attentive and I really liked how a colour page was provided for the kids to keep them occupied. The kids menu was very appropriate for kids pallets which I appreciated. Adults menu was great too and nice nod to Canadian food (ie. Arctic char and sourdough from a local toronto bakery). Only areas for improvement is to the facilities. It needs some TLC as some chairs were not comfortable & chipped corners of the table. Cleanliness can be improved as well as many marble post that appeared as we routed around the restaurant were dirty. Being the first sitting at 11:30am, I would have hoped these were wiped down the night before or prior to opening. These are the two areas that needs more attention and improvement.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
First , food safety is the most important thing, my son of 2 years old found several plastic paper in his soup, and the server said this is just tomato sauce reheat generated layer. Excuse me? Which tomato generate layer that makes plastic sound and is not possible to tear? If it was not a family group meal and I didn’t want to ruin the meal, I had already left the restaurant. The fact that this is kid soup and it could be offered to any other kids less than 2 and may not even tell that it was plastic and ate it made me feel so bad.
Then they forced to charge 20% tips without negotiation. If you question that, they will say this is already shown in your reservation.
Will never come back again and do not recommend.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
Dining at 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower was an unforgettable experience from start to finish. The rotating view offers breathtaking, panoramic sights of Toronto that make the meal feel truly special and unique. Watching the city slowly unfold beneath you while dining is absolutely mesmerizing.

The food was exceptional—beautifully presented, perfectly prepared, and full of refined flavors. Every course felt thoughtfully crafted, highlighting high-quality ingredients and excellent culinary skill. The service was equally impressive: attentive, professional, and warm, making us feel welcome without ever being intrusive.

This restaurant is more than just a meal—it’s a complete experience. Whether for a special occasion or a once-in-a-lifetime visit, 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower delivers elegance, atmosphere, and outstanding cuisine. Highly recommended!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: A great experience that’s definitely recommended. Amazing view, very professional and friendly staff, and unique, delicious food. The atmosphere is nice and calm, without any unnecessary noise. It’s recommended to check the weather before making a reservation.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: The food was very bad the chef did not take any pride in his work very horrible service worst restaurant experience

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Recently went here with the family, no doubt the prices were high but the view makes it worth it.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
The ambiance is top notch not to mention the breathtaking views 1200ft above. I don't think there's any restaurant that will beat 360. They set the undeniable golden standard. Cosy and fancy 💯.

Perfect spot for events such as birthdays, dates, engagement, chill nights and whatever you wish

This is classy & boujee for sure 👌

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Amazing experience with a stunning view of Toronto from such a high point. The price is a bit on the higher side, but it’s truly a unique, once-in-a-lifetime experience and definitely worth it. I really enjoyed the steak with the wine sauce, and the non-alcoholic drinks were great especially the coconut one. I highly recommend visiting 360 Restaurant at least once.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
Had an amazing time celebrating New Years Eve at the CN Tower. We came here to enjoy their holiday pre fixe menu.

Finding and navigating the tower can be confusing at first, but there is lots of signage and staff to guide you along the way. Wherever you are seated, you’ll be able to see the city. There will be enough time during your meal to see a full 360 view of Toronto.

The New Years Eve Pre Fixe Menu was great. Everything tasted delicious and flavorful. No complaints. The portions of each course were the perfect size.

Our server Jeff and the staff were very professional and courteous. Jeff did an excellent job and made sure we had a great experience.

FYI: They automatically ADD ON A 20% gratuity charge.

After dinner you can go downstairs to the observation deck. Then go down another floor to experience the glass floor.

Recommend to any first time visitors to Toronto!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: The food quality didn't quite meet expectations!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: The food is tasty and the view impressive.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Very cool experience. Food was amazing, which was not expected. Views were great. Too many loud kids around, unfortunately. Definitely a unique experience, would recommend dinner here if you are in town.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: This was an amazing experience. The only truly off-putting thing is that to start we were seated in the "upper section"; thankfully we were able to be moved to the lower section by the windows for the second half of our meal. The price-justification and cachet of the 360 restaurant are the views of course, and the upper section is a completely subpar experience by comparison. When booking, make sure you book for the "lower" window level. Honestly, other than tables for two right by the half-wall, they should not be seating anyone on the upper level at all. Our 2nd half experience was absolutely amazing, but if we had not been able to move down to the lower level with the amazing views I can tell you that I would have been absolutely furious and it would've ruined the evening.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: This is really fantastic restaurant you must visit because if you have booking here, no need ticket for CN tower and no line up the go to CN tower. First time to try this restaurant at dinner time. Night view is fantastic and incredible . Food quality is high level as well, matching the price and view. We order combo set of adult and kid, Strongly recommend to have booking during lunch and dinner if you would like to visit CN tower.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: It's an amazing ambience with good food. We did not order any drinks so I cannot comment on that. The best was the service! Steve our waiter was very attentive and professional, timing everything accordingly and very precise. The outstanding service received during our visit will definitely bring us back.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Service was excellent. Wait Staff was very attentive by always filling our water and wine glass.  Waiter offered a carafe to decant the wine. Checking to make sure we had everything we needed. Very friendly. Ambiance is on the sull side and could be improved. Burger should be offered on the kids menu.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Truffle tries cost $20 comes in a tiny plate with no parm. The server tall, no hair fought me to tell me how the truffle was in aioli. Excuse me? For $20 shaved parm on truffle fries is a must. Fries were sub par.  Lamb was okay, our bill was over $3k and to not be served a bit more than what was on the menu was very off putting. That server needs to simmer down a bit

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
We recently dined at the 360 Restaurant at the CN Tower and left feeling conflicted. While the food, wine, and cocktails were genuinely delicious, the overall experience did not align with what is advertised—or priced—as fine dining.
From the start, the service fell short of fine dining standards. Our server was very difficult to understand and shared personal stories (including about receiving a police ticket) and asked personal questions that felt inappropriate in a high-end dining environment. This points to a need for more thorough training around professionalism and guest interaction.
There were also several operational issues that detracted from the experience. We were told the restaurant had run out of candles and did not have enough for each table. The latte machine was broken, yet a regular coffee with a small amount of milk was presented as a latte, which felt misleading.
Additionally, the atmosphere did not reflect a fine dining setting. There was a noticeable mismatch in customer attire—one table dressed in hoodies and sweatpants, another in blazers and dresses—which created an inconsistent and confusing experience. If 360 positions itself as fine dining, clearer expectations around dress code and ambiance should be set and upheld.
Unfortunately, the experience felt no different in service quality than dining at a casual chain restaurant like Kelsey’s or East Side Mario’s—aside from the exceptional view. Based on our experience, the quality of service and overall expectations at 360 appear to have declined over the years, and the current price point no longer feels justified.
In summary, while the culinary side remains strong, significant improvements are needed in service training, atmosphere, and expectation-setting to truly deliver a fine dining experience that matches the cost and reputation of this iconic venue.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
We got terrible experience from servers in the restaurant. Service was lower than we expected for the price they charge. We paid 900$ for 7 people. They mixed up one of our orders, spilled the water on the table, brought us moulded sweet potatoes. Food was mediocre.
And the most unacceptable thing was that our server pre-included 20% tips without even asking us. As we didn’t have experience before, we thought that it was restaurant’s policy. But after reading reviews here I understand that the waiter just fooled us.
I would not recommend 360 to anyone!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: We still here today, and the food experience was very bad. The food or whithout flavor or with bad flavor. The employers just want go home, they dont care about your experience.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Nice view the menu needs a change been here few occasions.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: My husband took me here for our anniversary. Apart from the view and the nice restaurant, there wasn’t much going on. The food we ordered was terrible, my husband got the prime rib and I got the salmon which was paired with tomato sauce. Both were incredibly bland, we ended up leaving more the 50% of our food. The appetizer with shishito peppers and hummus was nice. But tomato sauce should not be paired with salmon and a little seasoning wouldn’t hurt. My husband said there was a lot of fat on his steak and it tasted bland and from the looks of it, it was almost pale and absolutely not juicy or succulent. This restauraunt was extremely over hyped. Our server rushed us and didn’t really recommend anything. Will not be returning.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Babu and the team in section 6 were brilliant! We visited on Dec 14 for dinner and booked an early seating so we could see the sun set. The weather played nice and the sky was clear and we had a stunning view. Inside the restaurant, Babu lead his team through a great service and was very patient with a group of chatty girlfriends hanging out. He was also great with accommodating dietary restrictions. The evening was lovely and everyone agrees it's definitely going to be on the list for when friends and family visit in the future.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
We came to celebrate our anniversary and were disappointed that there was no acknowledgment, especially after seeing other guests mention special anniversary treats in reviews.
During payment, we had technical issues with Apple Pay and did not have a physical card, so we split the bill between cash and card. Despite our intention to tip, the server made jokes about it, which felt unprofessional and made the experience uncomfortable.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Absolutely amazing experience friendly service and food was good and The view was phenomenal , fantastic and very beautiful Our server was so friendly ❤️♥️♥️Thank you 🙏

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Had dinner at the 360 with my wife. My wife chose the indigenous menu and I chose the $75 pre fix. Quite honestly for what you pay the food is just not very good. On a positive note, service was great. The keg would have been a much better choice

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
I was on a layover enroute to UAE and recently had a dinner here with a friend who I haven’t seen in a long time.
The service started out strong (friendly, took photos) and then gradually the experience crumbled.
The server at first was pleasant informative, however she coughed the entire time and took away from the experience. My thought is, if you’re sick and coughing don’t come to work and risk getting others sick especially in the food service industry.

The food itself was ok, I asked for an additional sauce for my prime rib and the presenting server was telling me that I had sauce right in front me. I said I know this, I just wanted another one. He seemed annoyed that I asked for more sauce. When you spend an additional $45 for an upsell I think you can have more sauce.
My biggest pet peeve of the evening was we felt rushed. As we were eating bread they tried to take it away and I said we were still eating.

When we were wanting to order desert our server was no where to be found.

When I was mid sentence showing my friend a video on my phone, the server interrupted us to ask us if we wanted separate bills. I explained to her we were busy at the moment, and she seemed annoyed she had to wait for our response. It was apparent her shift was nearing an end and we were the last folks in her section to leave.

No server had a problem asking me for a 25% tip on their mediocre, get the heck out of here service for a $165.00 meal.

Lastly this place was cold , they can easily turn up the heat, but they choose to save on costs and keep the place cold.

With transportation costs from my airport hotel, and meal this cost $400, the restaurant service diminished the high level city light experience.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: The food are okay. You're pretty much paying for the experience.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: My meal was amazing. They accommodated my allergies so well. Only thing I would note is our servers cocktail knowledge. I asked if they could do their signature sour with aquafaba, and the server had no clue what that was. Fair enough, so i clarified and asked for the vegan alternative to egg whites- once again, did not know. A little odd but otherwise a lovely evening!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: We loved it—great food and a stunning 360° view of Toronto 💕

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Food took a while but we'll worth it our wait staff James was absolutely amazing 💯

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Food and service could be better, but overall atmosphere is great

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: The food and service was excellent.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
Amazing experience at 360 Restaurant! Great food, excellent service, and breathtaking city views.Perfect place for a special occasion
Truly memorable!!!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Our server was the best. A decent humanitarian who understand people and excellent customer service...we celebrated our dear friend 46th birthday. A great vibe and memory

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Stunning views on Toronto, enriching experience, perfect for a romantic event, gastronomic food, they try, not as a top class french restaurant but not bad for North Amercia, Beef is at +40$.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
Good overall.
Food was fine.
Waiter was nice.
View is amazing.
Recommend once but not something I would do twice.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: The Seafood Tower is amazing and services are great. Also fun to go downstairs to the observation levels to take pictures and walk on the glass floors.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: This was an amazing experience to top off an incredible, if short, trip to Toronto. The staff were so friendly and helpful, the food was amazing, and obviously the views were breathtaking. Thank you so much.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Great food and service. Also beautiful views of the city

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: A memorable night at Toronto’s 360 Revolving Restaurant with my beautiful family. Good food, stunning views, and the best company - a perfect combination for a truly unforgettable experience.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: I think the only nice thing about the restaurant is the view because the food was terrible. Although they changed the appetizer I ordered because I couldn't eat it, the other one wasn't any better, and the main courses weren't good at all. The view was beautiful and romantic.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: The food excellent and amazing view love it will be back

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: We had a lovely evening. Great service and the view was incredible.  We will definitely be back soon.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Excellent food, service and atmosphere.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: The view and ambience at 360 Restaurant were amazing, but the food was extremely disappointing. From starter to dessert everything was bland, poorly presented, and far below expectations. The overall experience of being at the top of the CN Tower was the only highlight.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Book ahead on their website to guarantee the table. They were all booked when we went (people without tickets were turned away). It is great to go closer to sunset time, as the colors in the sky make it so much more beautiful. I loved the cocktails. When you book your ticket to the restaurant (min 75 spent per person), you also get access to observatory deck. I went to just observatory deck a while back, and I recommend to get restaurant experience, it is much more elevated and enjoyable. Observatory deck is full of people. Restaurant makes you enjoy your time. It is great it rotates, so you can always enjoy the change of view. ❤️

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Must visit restaurant. You get a great dinner with the set course menu and it allows you to enjoy the view while the crowd is gone.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Little disappointed in the whole aspect...it ended to be very expensive and the food was mediocre. The deserts were good. Bobby served our food and he was exceptional....

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Food much better than expected (though pricey of course). Loved the white chocolate mousse cake. The view is unbeatable. Would probably do again for a special occasion.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: The food and was service was great!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
Exceptional Dinner Experience – 10/10!
What an absolutely fantastic dining experience! From the moment we arrived, everything was on another level. The food and drinks were truly amazing — every dish was bursting with flavor, beautifully presented, and cooked to perfection. Definitely a solid 10/10!
The service deserves its own praise. The staff were incredibly friendly, attentive, and unbelievably fast. They catered to everyone at our table with genuine care and made sure we had everything we needed. They even helped us take photos, which was such a thoughtful and appreciated touch.
The whole evening felt effortless and enjoyable thanks to the wonderful team and delicious food. One of the best dining experiences I’ve had in a long time. Highly recommend!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
Horrible experience!! The waiter - his name is JEWEL, shouldn’t be working in customer service. He was very rude, bizarre and straight up acting on edge.
He body shamed my friend and I. Telling my friend about diet when she tried to order. Then went ahead and talked about how his wife was now on diet, how his life had already ended because he has kids. Just bizarre!!
I got the manager to come over to the table and told him what had just happened with the waiter. He left and later came back offering us a desert menu!!!😂😂😂ooh the irony in that! Offering us junk after body shaming!!
The food was so AWFUL!! It was like someone had sucked all the spices and flavours from it then put it back on the plate🤢.
Won’t be going back to this restaurant that’s for sure!!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: My husband proposed to me here. It was magical! Love the ambience of this place and my waiter was so helpful with explaining the menu items.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Came here for my birthday expecting a good experience and evening , was extremely let down and disappointed this place would be nothing without the view . server was fine , pretty invisible after the food arrived but i ordered the Seafood tower or something like that, that was one of the biggest disappointments and mistakes of that night including picking this place to eat . once i realized that i ordered another meal to make up for it because i didnt want the night to be a waste especially on my birthday, the steak i ordered took forever to come out and had to be sent back because it was extremely undercooked and when it came back it was still undercooked which made me leave it and ask for the bill and leave . $450 usd, wasted.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Our $202 gratuity was automatically added to our bill which is fine , but then we were prompted to add another tip on the debit machine and verbally by the server. I was not about to tip more than the $202 already added to my bill. I had to manually enter a $0 on the debit machine and then was given a disapproving look by the server.  I was made to feel very awkward even after spending $1375 on dinner including the $202 gratuity.  Very uncomfortable ending to a nice dinner. Service wasn’t great either for such a nice place. I mentioned this all on their survey sent out the next day and received no response.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Had the most beautiful anniversary dinner here — warm service, stunning dishes, and an ambience that made the night feel special. 🥂✨

The pacing was perfect, the staff were genuinely thoughtful, and the complimentary access to both the main and lower observation levels was such a bonus. The views made everything unforgettable. 🍽️🌙

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
We were here for my birthday. I expected very better and beautiful interior design, but it was not what I expected. Our host was good but food was disappointing. We ordered beef ribs and salmon for main course. The salmon was ok but it was cold. But the texture of the meat was awful.
In comparing the other 360 restaurants in other countries, it was really bad.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: We went yesterday & unfortunately the weather was bad. We decided to stay & eat. Thankfully the food was very good, so much so we decided to return the following day (today). Weather was so much better which meant incredible views whilst dining. We both loved the food & the service from Bobby was top class. Amazing server & a credit to 360. Would truly recommend this to anyone thinking of going, plus you get free admission to the main observation deck after dining. Thank you for a wonderful experience!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Terrible experience at the 360 Restaurant. Our server, Ricky, was very rude, and the food was disappointing and not worth the price. Only the view was nice. Would not go back.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
Went there to celebrate my birthday. As we exited purple elevator, 2 girls instructed us to stand for photo, so we did. Pretty sure you can refuse if you don’t want to but since it is our first time & none of in a review described this, we did what we asked. Later we found out the picture they took is for us to purchase (if we interested in) for $45+tax cash as the girl came to our table show us the picture & ask if we’d like to purchase it. Anyway, restaurant was busy considering it’s Sunday night, however, my daughter has reserve table for 3 so they sit us by the window which is amazing! The place is rotating 360 degree in 72 minutes as we were told. We were lucky to have a clear night. The foods overall were good. I ordered
red wine sangria as the other reviewer suggested. Love it & recommended. I picked 2 course with mussels as my appetizer & chicken for my main. The mussels was alright & in big portion for me. I think I got 1/4 chicken leg with bone removed from the thigh (not sure). It was delicious however the veggies that come with it not so much. My daughter picked the same 2 course meal with shishito peppers. She said it’s delicious & not too spicy. Salmon for her main tastes great. My husband on the other hand ordered ala carte caesar salad. He loves the dressing. King Cole duck duo for his main. He’s not too keen on veggies either. It’s dry.
Overall we enjoyed our evening in the city of Toronto. Amazing night out with lots of picture.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Excellent experience with a rotating floor restaurant. Food was a little on expensive side but worth it because it includes the access to the attraction. Pick a reservation just before sunset to maximize the views.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
We went into this lunch with very low expectations — we honestly assumed people come here just for the view and the food would be an afterthought. But WOW… we were so wrong, in the best way possible.
Grilled Octopus
This dish alone changed the tone of the entire lunch. Perfectly cooked — tender, not chewy — with a beautiful char. The greens and sauce complemented it so well, every bite worked. Easily one of the best octopus plates we've had lately.

Duck Breast + Confit
Medium-rare plus, exactly how duck should be. Rich flavor, juicy inside, and that crispy confit skin… perfection. If you’re a duck lover, this one will make you happy.
Lamb Shank
Fall-off-the-bone tender, super flavorful, and beautifully plated. The only note from us — we wished the polenta puree under it was a bit thicker to balance the sauce. Still delicious overall.

White Mousse Dessert
This one surprised us — light, creamy, refreshing and perfectly sweet. It was the perfect finish to an unexpectedly great meal.
Final Verdict
We came for the view… and left talking about the food. 360 is absolutely worth the experience — the rotating skyline, the energy, and yes, the dishes are genuinely good. If you’re in Toronto, put this on your list.

We’ll definitely be back.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: I absolutely loved the view and the food. The service was excellent — the servers were attentive at all times and very friendly. Everything made the experience truly enjoyable.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Food was not good. Was expecting more of a gourmet food but it was more like diner type of food quality. I got salmon and mussels but the sauce the smell was over powering like a bad sea food smell. For the price we paying you should do a better food menu

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: You go there only for the view. Really touristic attraction. Food was cold and not that tasty. Service was good though. Sadly, the experience doesn't worth the price. Wine list need to be updated!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
While the atmosphere is quite frankly amazing, the food doesn’t come close to matching it. Although, the servers (not service due to long wait times) do make up for it a little.

TLDR; Food comped, steak + replacement overcooked and dry, servers + atmosphere good, would not come again.

From the start, if you have a reservation, expect to still wait in line for 20-30 min, regardless of the time of your reservation.

From being given the menus, it took a little over an hour to be given 2 steaks with fries. The steaks came overcooked, there was not a slither of pink inside of them. Mind you, we usually order medium but decided to try medium well since we thought this would be a place that could cook them properly. However, the server agreed that the steaks were past medium-well, and quite frankly they kind of tasted like they were past well done as well, but I’m not an expert in food by any means.

The steaks we received were tasteless, and the sauces that came with them didn’t help. While the fries were good, they weren’t much different than any less expensive place and the truffle sauce was a little gimmicky. The cocktails and drinks were quite good though.

The servers, although a bit blatantly putting on an act, are very polite and reassuring. Upon checking up on us and seeing our steak, it was taken back immediately. We were also checked up on multiple times while waiting. Ultimately, our steaks and dessert were made free. However, the second set of steaks somehow managed to make one of the steaks even tougher, albeit making the other one softer (although there’s still no pink). The server didn’t even have to ask when she looked at them and apologized extensively while telling us that she’ll talk to a manager because this experience was ridiculous.

It’s worth noting that although obvious, it’s probably not the best idea for the staff to loudly say “where did that table go”… “they left”… “why’d they leave”… when people are sitting and waiting for food… kind of makes you want to follow their lead.

While this may be a one off, I read comments with similar grievances before coming, so at this point I’m discouraged from coming back… especially for an anniversary.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: It was a lovely evening. The food is excellent and we felt well cared for. The views of the city lights were very entertaining.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: We were 30 min late due to bad traffic on the Gardiner coming into town. Staff was really great at accommodating our late arrival. Food was perfect, our server was pleasant. Thank you guys for a great night!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ A Wholesome, Once-in-a-Lifetime Experience at the CN Tower Restaurant

I don’t even know where to begin—my experience at the CN Tower restaurant was easily one of the best moments of my life. Harsh had always promised me crazy, unforgettable things, and this time he truly delivered.

From the moment we stepped into the tower, everything felt magical. The views were breathtaking—Toronto glowing beneath us as the restaurant slowly rotated, giving us a 360° panorama without ever leaving our seats. The atmosphere was warm, elegant, and absolutely perfect for a special night.

The food was outstanding, but the indefinous mushroom soup was on a whole different level. I still can’t forget the richness of that soup—the deep, earthy flavor paired with the tangy honey-pickled mushrooms was unforgettable. It was the kind of dish that stays with you long after the meal is over.
More than the view and the food, though, it was the feeling of being there—sharing that moment, that surprise, that promise fulfilled—that made the night truly special.

It wasn’t just dinner; it was an experience. A wholesome, heart-filling, beautifully memorable experience. If you ever get the chance to go—especially with someone who makes the moment special—don’t think twice.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: A very memorable birthday dinner！！！

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
The view from the CN Tower restaurant was truly spectacular and worth visiting for the scenery alone. However, our dining experience was unfortunately overshadowed by the attitude of one of the male servers.
There were three of us, and as soon as we were seated, he asked who spoke English the best. He then said he would only explain the menu to that person and told them to explain it to the others, adding that he didn’t want to repeat himself. This made us feel uncomfortable and disrespected. We understand English well, but regardless of one’s language ability, such behavior is inappropriate and unprofessional.
Additionally, the server forgot the beer we ordered. When we reminded him and finally received the drinks, our main dishes had already gone cold.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Really good deal for lunch and tour. Prime Rib was very delicious. Great view of the city.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Feels expensive but if you consider the tickets included, makes total sense. Great view, outstanding service and great food quality. I particularly liked the chowder soup.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Overpriced, but you pay for the experience - which is worth it in my opinion. Service was quick and friendly, but the limited and pricey menu prevented 5 stars. I would still highly recommend coming to eat dinner here at least once though!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
I couldn't fault this restaurant at all, the entire evening was flawless from beginning to end. Jeff's service was outstanding; he made us feel completely at home and was incredibly warm and engaging. We were celebrating our engagement, so it was a truly memorable night we wanted to cherish.

To start, the slowly rotating 360-degree views of Toronto are stunning, and the food was equally impressive. I had the mussels followed by the steak, both of which were exceptional. My fiancée loved her grilled peppers and mushroom pasta too.

Overall, it was a perfect evening with superb food, service, and great views of the city!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Totally worth it, while the food is a bit on the expensive side, the fact you get access to the tower  it makes a worthy investment. Food is ok, not exceptional, but we went for the views anyway

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
I came here for dinner as a tourist as I wanted to check out the revolving restaurant and try the food.

You need to spend a minimum of $75 and that's just on food (not drinks), they have al la carte for a Prix Fixe menu for $75 so we opted for that - made it a lot easier. You need to reserve a table online also however you can only to up a month in advance.

I went for the grilled calamari starter/appetizer and Fogo Island Cod main/entrée. Both were delicious, the calamari had a really nice, extra savoury taste from being pan fried and was cooked perfectly, tentacles included which I loved! The Fogo cod came with a herb crust, tomato based sauce and some new potatoes underneath. Cod itself was perfect, I was indifferent about the herb crust but didn't mind it. The tomato sauce was slightly bland and the potatoes could've been softer for my liking but overall decent.

My companion went with the Salmon Gravlax to start and Maple Chilli Chicken Supreme. She didn't care for the berries with the salmon, it was cured and she also felt it wasn't the best quality (tasted like supermarket smoked salmon slices). The maple chicken itself was well cooked, moist and the glaze/sauce used wasn't too sweet & perfectly balanced. Found the potato pavé lacking flavour and cold sadly.

A great experience overall and I enjoyed going. You also get access to the main observation deck as part of your reservation too.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
The hype of this restaurant did not meet the expectations that you would see in reviews. Though the view is beautiful when you ask for a window seat celebrating an anniversary and then don’t get one. It’s quite disappointing to start your experience. We had a server named Mike Sg Who is less than attentive throughout the entire dinner. The bus boy gave us more attention than the server and constantly clearing and checking in on us throughout the dinner. We saw the server to place our order after he dropped off drinks. We’ve never saw him again until the check was coming.

We never were asked how our food was. We were never offered additional drinks. Had to ask another server for salt and pepper.

As previously mentioned, the hype of this restaurant was going to be a great experience and it did not meet that by any means. For dinner that was over $400 it sure was disappointing.!!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Honestly if you have children and would like to bring them to the CN Tower, this is the only way to do it. The meal cost covers the tickets into the tower, and ends up being a really good value. More importantly, it allows you to spend some time and enjoy the views of the city for more than the 5 minutes it will take for the children to get bored of the observation deck. Highly recommended!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
The view from 360 is stunning, but the service completely ruined our experience. We had a reservation at 8:30 pm and politely asked if we could move to a window table once one became available. Several tables opened, but our server ignored the request and spoke to us with a dismissive attitude. When he finally moved us, his tone became even more condescending.

By the end of the dinner, my mother was paying and decided not to leave a tip because of the poor service. The waiter actually said, “Are you not leaving a tip?” while standing over her, which was shockingly rude and unprofessional.

For a restaurant that charges a minimum of $75 per person, I expected respectful and welcoming service, not this attitude. The view is great, food is tasty, but our server made us feel uncomfortable the entire evening.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Good food, great espresso martinis, excellent views.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Wow. Such poor food standards. Steak overcooked, service very transactional, very much mediocre food. Would not visit again. View was great though! Zero wait time between courses. Don’t visit. Just do viewing deck and eat elsewhere

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Food and service was good. The rotating aspect of the restaurant is definitely a cool novelty

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Little bit on the costlier side! But service and food were good!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
I had an absolutely terrible experience at the 360 Restaurant at the CN Tower while trying to use my gift vouchers that I had from Feast On for my boyfriend’s 40th birthday dinner.

When I showed our vouchers to the server, he had to get the manager. The manager then asked to inspect my phone and emails and made us wait about over 30 minutes while he made “phone calls” to verify them — It was humiliating and made me feel like I was doing something wrong when I was simply trying to redeem a legitimate gift. After waiting that long, they ended up declining them, even after showing how they are on the actual feast on ontario website.

To make things worse, the food was disappointing. The prime rib was fatty and grilled like a steak, and the chicken was dry and rubbery.

What was supposed to be a special night turned into one of the most uncomfortable and embarrassing dining experiences I’ve ever had. I left in tears. I would never recommend this restaurant to anyone — especially if you’re using a voucher or celebrating a special occasion. Absolutely degrading and disappointing. I reached out to feast on and they were incredibly apologetic and disappointed for me. What is supposed to encourage you to experience new restaurants, turned into a complete discouraging awful one.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Atmosphere is amazing but the food is decent at best and the servers all have a horrible attitude…they are rude or just ignore you constantly

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: We were there for our anniversary and had a terrific dinner. Dinner was delicious service excellent. Bobby our server, was excellent, gracious, and attentive.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Incredible view, good food an decent drinks, but the service not that good, from the begining the waiter was counting each price warning us about the $75 minimun per person, i wasnt asking.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Went for dinner in a group. This is a tourist trap higher than normal prices are expected. They try to source food locally and surprisingly the prices were reasonable- 3 courses for $100.00. However even though the food was good the portion sizes were small. Service was good, but the place is quite loud. They offer a chocolate dessert, but it is only available as a vegan option. They should offer a non-vegan version

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Great view. Better food and friendly.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
I had a good dinner, but a fantastic view and that is what you will pay for. Beautiful views especially if you go for sunset!!

If you like seafood, specifically scallops, definitely get them, they are delicious!

An iconic “one time” experience!!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Very friendly atmosphere  I like it very much

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Our waiter in section 9 (and his support staff) were great.  I think his name was Justin?  We brought friends from Poland who were visiting and we all thought it was an incredible experience.  I forgot as a Torontonian how great a spot it is!  Hope to visit again soon.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: After spending $500 walked out very disappointed. The menu is absolutely horrible and needs an overhaul. for example, spending $90 on steak and if you don’t order sides, it comes on a plate with nothing on it. Servers arguing on sides. Only 2 Sharable apps. view is great but food is not.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
We went to the 360 Restaurant at the CN Tower to celebrate my boyfriend’s birthday — a very special day that we were truly excited about. We expected a world-class experience from such a famous and expensive restaurant. But the moment our food arrived, we were shocked to see a fly sitting on top of the dish.

This completely ruined our appetite and the mood of our celebration. Although the waiter replaced the food, the damage was already done. We still paid the full bill and even left a tip out of respect, but honestly, this should never happen in a restaurant of this level.

It was embarrassing, disappointing, and offensive to experience such poor hygiene and quality control at one of Toronto’s most iconic dining spots. I truly hope management takes this seriously, because no guest should go through this — especially during a special occasion.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Besides the amazing view, the food was delicious , we loved the presentation. The service was great, exactly what we would expect it to be. Everything was explained very well, this is a great way to view the city and have an awesome meal.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Food was exceptional. Ambience and experience was top class. Only the quantity of Sangria pitcher was very less. It should be atleast 4 Glass servings as per the standards of a pitcher.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Amazing experience, with even better  service!  Thank you Spiro.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: The best thing about this restaurant is the amazing view and the novelty of a rotating restaurant 1000 ft in the air. Otherwise, the food was mid for the price ($75 per person) and the service provided by our hostess was lackluster. We did appreciate the busser / server assistant for helping us with our various requests.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
Great views and an experience to have dinner
Unfortunately the food was not good. I had calamari to start, it was cool in temperature and wet with oil. The beef I had for main was just okay. Probably not worth visiting the restaurant and just go up for the views.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
we visited to celebrate a birthday and left with such wonderful memories!!
the steak was a bit underwhelming but the lobster and risotto were absolutely delicious!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
Very beautiful view but the staff just try to send you away asap and it was not pleasant.
Food was average with overcooked fish.
Very expensive view…

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Had dinner here on a Saturday night and sat by the windows. Ate good food but had terrible service by our waiter Hameed. Made our experience very unpleasant and not want to come back. BEWARE IF YOU GET THIS WAITER ASK FOR ANOTHER ONE!!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: For such a tourist spot, the foods are especially creative, love that!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Absolutely amazing time. Food and service was amazing. And the view is top notch

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: The food truly surpassed my expectations in both taste and presentation. I tried something outside my usual choices and was amazing. The service was top-notch, and the revolving view of Toronto added a unique and memorable touch to the experience. It’s an ideal place for a special celebration or for anyone exploring the city. I’d definitely recommend it!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: What an amazing experience! Beautiful!  Took a few minutes to get used to the rotating building but other than that, it was wonderful food was delicious

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
Made my reservation at 9pm and arrived on time. However, it took an additional 35minutes to be seated. Before being seated, I walked to the hostess stand and saw 3 employees talking amongst themselves ignoring me to the point where I had to ask the hostess/manager if we were going to be seated at all.

Shortly after, they apologized and immediately found us a table. Due to this reaction, I felt that they had forgotten about my wife and I and attempted to recover by giving us a table within seconds.

Additionally, our server seemed like he was in a bad mood and did not arrive back at our table for about 20mins after the first visit. At this point, it is approximately 9:50pm and I had to ask a different server that we were ready for our order (he was polite).

Food -

risotto 1/10 way too much oil felt like you were drinking soup

Cod 1/10 bland overall flavorless

Grilled calamari 9/10 really flavourful highly recommend

Spaghetti 2/10 flavorless.

This visit was for our wedding anniversary and was overall disappointed with the experience. I am not one to usually write reviews but felt that this messaged needed to be conveyed in order to help for the next guest's experience.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Food is nice, service not

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Everything was great except for my plate of food. I ordered the half lobster and I literally was only able to only get one piece of good lobster meat off of it.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Amazing view of city while having food. Amazing food. Highly recommended

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: It is all about the view, absolutely fabulous way to take it in. Would definitely go back to restaurant if I wanted to see the view from the CN Tower again. Much better value than observation level tickets.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
Came here with family and some extended family visiting Canada for the first time. We decided to get the nachos and it was expensive but it did come very fast!

When we got the nachos, we saw that there wasn’t enough cheese on it, so when we complained about it, they came took it away and got us a brand new one with more cheese, no questions asked!

Very attentive and helpful staff members that are understanding. Their brownies were also the best I ever had and the cookies weren’t bad either! I do recommend eating here and enjoying the beautiful views from the CN tower of Downtown Toronto, Lake Ontario and the surrounding GTA. It’s amazing to see the view from so high with good food especially if you’re new to the area or visiting!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Amazing views and delicious food! Such a stark contrast between the experience in the restaurant versus the main observation deck below. We enjoyed admiring the view in the comfort of our dining table. You do notice the rotation but it is not motion sickness inducing at all. It took about 1 hr for a full rotation. 360 guests have their own dedicated elevator so we didn't have to queue at all. Our server Keith was amazing, and the food, even though somewhat overpriced, was delicious! Ordered the Alfredo pasta for our toddler, and for a simple kid's meal, it was absolutely delicious, the adults ended up eating most of it. Ended up spending almost $300 USD for 3 adults and 1 toddler, including tip. Overall, it was worth it. You must reserve online ahead of time- reserved ours about 2 months ahead.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
The views are absolutely the reason to go. The location and overall experience are what make 360 special.

The service was good and there was no wait time to be seated.

That said, I’ll be honest — my first visit about a year ago (during the day) was much better. On this last visit, the food quality was a bit disappointing compared to before.

It’s definitely an expensive place, but you’re really paying for the views and the unique experience, not so much for a top-tier culinary experience. Still, it’s worth visiting at least once — especially if you’ve never been.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: I Had food and drinks at youth center after burial and funeral active.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: The view is nice, but the service completely ruined the experience. Our waitress, Juli, was rude and disrespectful from the start. Her unwelcoming attitude made us feel uncomfortable and spoiled the visit.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Oysters had dirt and shells in them. We ordered a half dozen and 5 of them were still dirty and gritty. Lamb chops would’ve been better with a different seasoning, maybe a mint sauce. Wasn’t a personal fan. The issue was the scallops - served ice cold when we were told it was a hot dish. We were then told to order something else if we didn’t like the scallops cooked that way. Terrible experience considering the price and venue - would definitely not ever recommend. You’d think torontos biggest attraction could have at least decent food. Overall 3/10

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: It was an experience of a lifetime. We were made to feel special from the moment we walked through the door. The service was exceptional and the food was exquisite.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
I am saying this with genuine concern, the food I got today was actually great but our server, MIKE was unbelievably rude! It’s too bad because I quite enjoyed the muscles and the prime rib that I got. Pricey but I get it, you are here for the experience. This was my first time dining at 360 restaurant. The pre-fixe menu had reasonable options in my opinion.

To break it down, Mike asked us if we wanted still water or sparkling. Everyone was quite busy chatting as we were a big table of 10. Then came the glass bottles of water, which cost our table an additional $40+.

Then other servers who were helping Mike suddenly offered us tap water for refills after the first course was complete. We were the only table who were upsold bottled water in our section of the dining hall.

Mike was consistently aggressive the entire evening. From asking from the beginning if we’re paying only with one bill. I have never been asked this question before at any other sit-down restaurant prior to a meal. He barely attended our table, his colleagues did. Most of us got steaks and 3 of us didn’t get steak knives. We had to ask for it. He was also standing there supervising and not once did he offer us water refills. His two teammates I guess were tasked to help him.

When I was finally decided on what alcoholic drink to get; Mike was nowhere to be found so I had to ask another server for the beer. Mind you I waited for about 10 minutes or so and good thing his colleague came by with more water.

He also seemed pretty upset that we did separate bills as well. For a group of ten individuals. Was he really expecting anybody from one big table to foot a bill of $1,100+? It was quite obvious that this was not a family dinner. And we were a group of friends. My bill alone was $140+ with automatic gratuity included in the bill. That tip hopefully was shared with his colleagues as I would not have given such a big tip for a disappointing experience with our server, Mike.

I also need to highlight that for some reason, my apple pay didn’t go through twice using the debit machine. I am not sure why either. But his response to this was “DECLINED SIR” both times insinuating that I was at fault that their machine somehow didn’t accept my apple pay tap. I used my actual debit card instead and then that worked for some reason.

I even witnessed this guy point to my friend on my left giving him a signal that it’s his turn to pay. You can see it from his facial expression as well on how he was impatient with my friend who was distracted talking to another friend on his left side.

Please remind your servers that people know 360 is not a cheap place to dine at. He made it seem that we were there as teenagers who was not ready to act like adults. I would never get this type of obnoxious service outside.

I don’t know what our server was going through outside of work, but that was the most uncomfortable I’ve been at a restaurant because of this server’s awful attitude towards guests.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: The view is amazing, service is also fantastic. The food was middy but overall worth it

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Great venue, polished and friendly service from Bobby (36 yrs he has worked there!), great martini and wonderful menu.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
Only the view and the food is good. Service is lacking. We were charged 20% gratuities on our bill which is $144 extra, for limited service.

Waiter just took the order and delivered the food. Service cant even compare to local restaurants like Joey, Milestone, Moxies......

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: The view is of course unbeatable! The food is understandably very overpriced and I wouldn't say the quality is that great. The service is also not the best... but I would still go at least once to experience dining above the entire city

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
I was very disappointed with my experience at 360 Restaurant. My reservation was at 5:15 pm, but I wasn’t seated until 5:50 pm. This was especially frustrating because I made the booking as a surprise marriage proposal for my partner, and it completely ruined the start of a very special evening.

On top of that, I paid an extra 135 CAD for a window table at 5:15 pm, so the table should have been ready when I arrived. Instead, I was told to wait because the table wasn’t available, which felt unacceptable considering the extra charge.

The service was also disappointing—our waiter even brought dessert without a fork. Overall, it left a very bad impression and I cannot recommend this place.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
A overwhelming experience for me as a photography buff and admirer of good food and service.

The views offered are simply awesome, you can see the surrounding as if from flight, don't forget to make a time lapse movie that would make you proud.

Food, as expected, was excellent, service very friendly and helpful while not being obtrusive. Big thanks to the server and usher lady.

To start with, the views from CN tower lift while ascending itself is quite rewarding. You are arriving at restaurant and after dining, you get free access to observation deck and glass window floor to look through and stand on the glass panels which offer the view if ground floor from 350 meter level. There you can buy the top deck ticket for 12 CAD and ride another lift to go to 450 meter level which is highest visitors can go. Nice view from there also, you can see two rail stations, lots of highways, Billy airport and numorous skyscrapers along with beautiful lake.

Tip - you can reserve the table at 360 in advance, can skip the line while entering tower, get free access to main observation deck and very good dining experience on the price of minimum 75 CAD spent per head in restaurant, where as you can buy a 80 CAD ticket for CN tower entry, long line with free vitamin D greets you and you have to spend extra on food with limited seating, access to only main deck levels and still have to pay 12 CAD extra for top deck. So, booking a table in 360 works out to be more rewarding.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Went there for my wife’s birthday and was really disappointed. The menu was weak, so we just had fries and drinks—but even that was overpriced. On top of it, they slapped on ridiculous charges like an “elevator fee” if you dont spend $75 per person. Definitely not worth it.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
We had an outstanding experience! Our server Zahid was incredibly attentive, friendly, and professional. Every detail was taken care of with a smile, and the recommendations were spot-on. The service truly elevated our evening and made our dinner even more enjoyable. Highly recommended!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
Amazing service with the man Carlos ! He really made my fiancé and myself , really feel like we were the only ones in the sky ! First time experiencing anything like this in my life ! Food was amazing . Strongly recommend Carlos , for that special night , with your special partner !

Kudos my friend , till we see you again .

Jeff and Michelle . Sept 27/2025

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: We really enjoyed our dinner at 360 Restaurant. The food was tasty, the service was friendly, and the view was amazing. A great experience overall!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
Horrible experience. Food over priced and very small portions. Server was extremely rude. For me, my husband and 9 year old son we spent $450 CAD and I wasn’t sure what I ate for that much. Horrible sky line. We were told you can go down a floor to see the skyline from the glass window but when you go there to take pictures over looking the skyline there are TV on the wall and lights all over that will give a glare in every direction.

Over all very bad.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: Beautiful restaurant with great service. Thank you to our waiter James who made the experience very enjoyable!

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review:
This is not just a meal, it’s an event, and not to be missed if you are in Toronto.

First… I think it is worth mentioning that whilst not cheap, this is a very good value restaurant if you compare similar experiences in London, Paris and elsewhere. The food is good quality, the service is delightful and the wine list has something to suit everyone.

It was the last day of our 30th wedding anniversary trip and the staff made a real fuss of us but without the being intrusive.

And why is this an experience. Fron 45 floors up, your table will do a full 360 degree rotation in 72 minutes. The view is fabulous.

Very highly recommended.

restaurant: 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower
review: The view is clearly the main event here.
